tradeviz: Financial Visualization Suite for TradingVerse

Source: R/tradeviz-package.R
tradeviz-package.Rd

A comprehensive visualization package for quantitative trading and investment research. Provides beautiful, publication-ready charts including candlesticks, equity curves, drawdown plots, correlation heatmaps, and more. Integrates seamlessly with the TradingVerse ecosystem (tradeengine, tradeio, tradefeatures). Supports both static (ggplot2) and interactive (plotly) visualizations with a consistent, intuitive API.

A comprehensive visualization package for quantitative trading and investment research. Provides beautiful, publication-ready charts with minimal code.

Key Features

Chart Plotting

Candlestick, OHLC, line, and area charts with indicator overlays

Performance Visualization

Equity curves, drawdown plots, return analysis

Risk Analytics

Correlation heatmaps, rolling metrics, efficient frontiers

Portfolio Analysis

Allocation pies, weight evolution, contribution attribution

Interactive Charts

Plotly integration for web-ready visualizations

Custom Themes

Professional trading-style themes and color palettes

Main Functions

plot_candles

Create candlestick charts

plot_equity_curve

Plot strategy equity curves

plot_drawdown

Visualize drawdowns

plot_correlation

Correlation heatmaps

plot_interactive

Make any plot interactive

plot_strategy_dashboard

Multi-panel strategy dashboard

Integration

tradeviz works seamlessly with other TradingVerse packages:

  • tradeengine: Visualize backtest results

  • tradeio: Plot fetched market data

  • tradefeatures: Show indicators on charts

  • trademetrics: Display performance metrics

See also

Useful links:

  • https://github.com/tradingverse/tradeviz

  • Report bugs at https://github.com/tradingverse/tradeviz/issues

Useful links:

Author

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(tradeviz)
library(tradeengine)
library(tradefeatures)

# Basic candlestick chart
data |> plot_candles()

# With indicators
data |>
  add_sma(20) |>
  plot_candles() |>
  add_indicator_line(sma_20, color = "blue")

# Backtest results
results |>
  plot_equity_curve()

# Interactive dashboard
results |>
  plot_strategy_dashboard() |>
  make_interactive()
} # }
